title: Sketches of Architectural Details, Baden
medium: Graphite on gray paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
description: Vertical sheet depicting three sketches of architectural details.  At left, a slender tower with octagonal domed cupola rises from a tiled roof.  Adjacent to the base of the tower is a cross seen in a three-quarter view.  The tower consists of two repeated sections: an arcade topped by an octagonal dome, that is surmounted by a tall finial with a ball and weathervane.  According to the artist's inscription, the cupola is made of "black slate / and wood / painted black."  At upper right is a very low dormer over a window that breaks the tiled roofline of, as the artist notes, a "convent / Baden."  Below right is the detailed sketch of a two-story dormer with glazed window and half-timbering decoration on the facade.  The artist notes that in the "top window there is a swinging oak bracket / for handing things up with."
name: Album page
